sorcer.jini.lookup.entry

Class SorcerServiceInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jini.entry.AbstractEntry
      • net.jini.lookup.entry.ServiceType
        • sorcer.jini.lookup.entry.SorcerServiceInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.jini.core.entry.Entry, net.jini.lookup.entry.ServiceControlled

    public class SorcerServiceInfo
extends net.jini.lookup.entry.ServiceType
    Human-oriented information about the "type" of a SORCER service. This is not related to its data or class types, and is more oriented towards allowing someone to determine what a service (for example, an optimizer) does and that it is similar to another, without needing to know anything about data or class types for the Java platform.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The host name this service in running on, for example, " hippolyta.cs.ttu.edu".
      java.lang.String iconName
      An icon file name associated with this service.
      java.lang.String location
      The location of this service, for example, "GE AE", "GE CRD".
      java.lang.Boolean matchInterfaceOnly
      If true, then matching is done for the interface only for space computing, otherwise matching additionally the provide name.
      java.lang.Boolean monitorable
      If true, then the provider is monitorable for exerting behavior, otherwise its actions can not be monitored.
      java.lang.String mutexId
      This provider's mutual exclusion lock ID for its service.
      java.lang.String providerName
      The name of provider (service) itself that is used by clients along with service type (interface) to identify tasks to be executed.
      java.lang.String[] publishedServices
      The list of published interfaces used by space workers.
      java.lang.Boolean puller
      Indicates if the service provider uses Exertion Space.
      java.lang.String repository
      The data store URL or host:port used by this service.
      java.lang.String serviceHome
      The home directory of the runtime service provider.
      net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceID serviceID
      A persistent UUID for this particular service.
      java.lang.String shortDescription
      The short service description that is presented to users.
      java.lang.String spaceGroup
      The exertion space group used by the registering provider.
      java.lang.String spaceName
      The exertion space name used by the registering provider.
      java.lang.String startDate
      The provider start date.
      java.lang.String userName
      The user name (login).

    • Field Detail

      • providerName

        public java.lang.String providerName
        The name of provider (service) itself that is used by clients along with service type (interface) to identify tasks to be executed. These tasks are placed by clients into the SORCER distributed space.

      • publishedServices

        public java.lang.String[] publishedServices
        The list of published interfaces used by space workers.

      • shortDescription

        public java.lang.String shortDescription
        The short service description that is presented to users.

        If true, then matching is done for the interface only for space computing, otherwise matching additionally the provide name.

      • monitorable

        public java.lang.Boolean monitorable
        If true, then the provider is monitorable for exerting behavior, otherwise its actions can not be monitored.

      • groups

        The list of participating groups.

      • spaceGroup

        The exertion space group used by the registering provider.

      • getIcon

        public java.awt.Image getIcon(int iconKind)
        Returns an icon for this service. Icons displayed in the SORCER service browser are 16x16 pixels.

        This particular implementation tries to find the resource specified by iconName in the configuration.

        Overrides:
        getIcon in class net.jini.lookup.entry.ServiceType
        Parameters:
        iconKind - type of icon requested. See BeanInfo for an explanation.
        Returns:
        the service icon.
        See Also:
        ServiceType.getIcon(int), BeanInfo.getIcon(int)
